model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: The only trick I was able to teach him, that I deeply regret, was how locks worked. I thought it was cool at first, you know, to see a raccoon unlock a door. And now, I regret it so much. I've had to change the layout of my apartment and put deadbolts on my doors so that Bandicoot can't get out. And, he is sneaky about it. One time, he unlocked the pantry and was eating some cookies! It's like having a toddler that never grows up.

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker B has been taking care of the raccoon for over a month and is interested in training it.
2. Speaker B believes raccoons can make good pets if cared for properly.
3. Bandicoot was a rescue and has been at the Raccoon Cafe since he was a baby.
4. Speaker A is dealing with a raccoon problem and plans to buy aluminum sheeting to cover up holes.
5. Speaker B owns a raccoon named Bandicoot and a bearded dragon named Bob.
6. Speaker A is worried about the raccoon potentially eating the bearded dragon.
